summary: I had always thought Deathbird was a Dave Cockrum creation but the visual evidently came from the pencil of Keith Pollard. Ms....
body: I had always thought Deathbird was a Dave Cockrum creation but the visual evidently came from the pencil of Keith Pollard. Ms. Marvel #22, February 1979. Cover artists Dave Cockrum and Terry Austin.

blog.name: mrdaps
blog.title: Mr. DAPs
blog.description:
Hi there!

I am Mr. DAPs, that guy with the hat that walks around Disneyland. I will mainly be posting some pictures that I have taken that I particularly like here but will occasionally post some other things.

You can read some of my other posts at any or all of the links below:

Blog: mrdaps.com
Website: dapsmagic.com
Twitter: twitter.com/mrdaps
Facebook: facebook.com/misterdaps

Please feel free to add me on any or all of the above links. I look forward to chatting with you and seeing you in the park!

Make it a GREAT day!

-Mr. DAPs

summary: Looking Forward at The Walt Disney Company's Schedule of Movies For 2019
title: Looking Forward at The Walt Disney Company's Schedule of Movies For 2019
body:
Looking Forward at The Walt Disney Company’s Schedule of Movies For 2019

With the recent release of movie trailers from The Walt Disney Company for Toy Story 4, Dumbo and The Lion King, it is readily apparent that 2019 is going to be a fun year for movies. However, those aren’t the only movies coming out from The Walt Disney Company in 2019. There are several others that shouldn’t be forgotten.

Captain Marvel – March 8, 2019

View On WordPress

summary: MCU CosmicCast Episode 33 Where is the Avengers 4 Trailer?
title: MCU CosmicCast Episode 33 Where is the Avengers 4 Trailer?
body:
MCU CosmicCast Episode 33 Where is the Avengers 4 Trailer?

Welcome to Episode 33 of the MCU ComsicCast. Due to the Thanksgiving holiday in the US, it was a bit of a slower week for MCU news, but this week’s podcast covers it all, explains what’s going on with the Avengers 4 trailer release, and even has a pretty cool new rumor about The Eternals:

  • Sony set two new Marvel release dates.
  • Fox’s Once Upon a Deadpool trailer is hilarious.
  • There was a little…

summary: One of the dumbest new reactionary Hot Takes is that there’s some big wave of "boyish" female characters that's drowning out...
body:
One of the dumbest new reactionary Hot Takes is that there’s some big wave of “boyish” female characters that’s drowning out “girly” female characters. They’ll cry wolf that “women have to look masculine to be respected!”

But really, as a “feminine” looking woman, I know that women like me get 99% of all female representation. People are just mad that non “feminine” females are getting any representation at all.

Because god forbid that a character with “she” in her name (She-Ra) is allowed to look like an actual 16 year old girl instead of embodying every female stereotype in the book. God forbid Captain Marvel doesn’t have a perfect hourglass figure, and is drawn with a non-girly face that lots of real women have. God forbid the Ghostbusters can include women that, honestly, look way more like your average woman than a thin, curvy, long-haired 24 year old does. 

God fucking forbid those women’s faces and bodies get replicated in media in any way.

Then women might start thinking it’s OKAY to look like that.

summary: Monica Rambeau Reading List Bold is the important stuff, links in names This is just to get people started. Obviously, she’s in...
caption:
Monica Rambeau Reading List

Bold is the important stuff, links in names

This is just to get people started. Obviously, she’s in more stuff, but she’s rarely the main character. The titles here she is a main character or it is important for her story

Spider-Man Annual 16 (Monica’s Introduction & Origin)

Avengers (1963) #227 (joins the Avengers) #279 (Is given lead of the Avengers)  #291-293 (Why she departs the Avengers, fair warning what happens is a little fucked up)

- I’ll do a more comprehensive list of the Avengers stuff on another post, honestly, you can skip this stuff and read like an overview I still haven’t read it all. 

Captain Marvel (1989)

- Two One-Shots, nice read, about the closest thing she’s gotten to a solo run :/// A warning though the second one is about racism

Avengers Unplugged #5

- Honestly not a great comic. But you learn why she changed her codename so I guess it’s important or something

Avengers: Infinity

- Super cosmic stuff, sets a precedent really (Stern again)

New Thunderbolts #8-9

- She’s in one panel in 8 so just like find that panel then skip through. and she’s in like a little bit of 9. Literally just here for another name change because Genis-Vel is a dick Like the first time understandable, dare I say valid, this time, dick move

Nextwave: Agents of H.A.T.E.

- So Nextwave is sooo good. While reading you must remember that it is all non-canon/retconned and is in comic limbo, but it is important later on!

Marvel Divas 

- Fun, short comic. It’s so nice to see Monica doing normal things with friends

Heralds

- Like Marvel Divas, but like not as good

Mighty Avengers & Captain America and the Mighty Avengers

- She basically leads them, fair warning Spider-man is Doc Ock at the beginning of Mighty Avengers and at the beginning of CA and the Mighty Avengers Sam Wilson and Luke Cage are affected by Hate Waves so they’re all dicks at the beginning, but it’s okay because it gets fixed. Do not read this without reading Nextwave I’m begging you. It’s actually an important plot point

The Ultimates (2016) & The Ultimates 2

- I’m not even kidding when I say this is one of my favorite comics if not my favorite. The team is Monica, Adam Brashear, T’Challa, America Chavez, and Carol Danvers. It is literally the best line-up ever (Except maybe Luke Cage’s Mighty Avengers). They solve the big problems that no one else can (like Galactus!!) This and (Captain America and the) Mighty Avengers are written Al Ewing and he’s such a good writer for her
